ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:0.6_0: Venerables, these thirty rules on relinquishment and confession come up for recitation.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Vesālī at the Gotamaka Shrine.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.2_0: At that time the Buddha had allowed the three robes for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.3_0: The monks from the group of six thought, “The monks from the group of six are allowed to enter a village monastery with another three robes without robes.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.4_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.5_0: “How can the monks from the group of six keep extra robes?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.6_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that you keep extra robes?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.10_0: “... Foolish men, how can you keep extra robes?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.11_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.12_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.13.1_0: ‘If a monk keeps an extra robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.14_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.1.1_0: At that time Venerable Ānanda had been given an extra robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.2_0: He wanted to give it to Venerable Sāriputta
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.4_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having extra robes, Ānanda thought,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.5_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.6_0: that you can’t keep extra robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.8_0: I wish to give this robe-cloth to Venerable Sāriputta
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.12_0: “How long is it, Ānanda, before Sāriputta returns?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.14_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.15_0: “Monks, you should keep an extra robe for ten days at the most.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.16_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.17.1_0: ‘When his robe is finished and the robe-making season has ended, a monk should keep an extra robe for ten days at the most.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.17.1_1: If one uses them beyond that, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.2_0: the monk has made a robe, or the robe-cloth has been lost, destroyed, or burnt, or he has abandoned his expectation of receiving further robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.4_0: it has ended according to one of the eight summaries or the Sangha has ended it, whichever comes first.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.6_0: it should be kept for ten days at a maximum.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.8_0: almsbowls that have neither been determined nor transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.10_0: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.1_0: If one uses them beyond that, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.2_0: it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the eleventh day.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.3_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.4_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.5_0: After approaching the Sangha, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.6_0: ‘Venerables, this robe which I have kept over ten days is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.7_0: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.8_0: After relinquishing it, he is to confess the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.9_0: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.10_0: The relinquished robe-cloth is then to be given back:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.11_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.12_0: This robe-cloth that was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so has been relinquished to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.13_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give this robe-cloth back to monk so-and-so.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.14_0: After approaching several monks, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.15_0: ‘Venerables, this robe which I have kept over ten days is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.16_0: I relinquish it to the venerables.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.17_0: After relinquishing it, he is to confess the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.18_0: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.19_0: The relinquished robe-cloth is then to be given back:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.20_0: ‘Please, I ask the venerables to listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.21_0: This robe-cloth that was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so has been relinquished to you.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.22_0: If it seems appropriate to you, you should give this robe-cloth back to monk so-and-so.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.23_0: After approaching a single monk, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.24_0: ‘This robe-cloth that I have kept over ten days is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.26_0: After relinquishing it, he is to confess the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.27_0: The confession should be received by that monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.28_0: The relinquished robe-cloth is then to be given back:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.29_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.1_0: If it is more than ten days, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.2_0: If it is more than ten days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.3_0: If it is more than ten days, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.4_0: If it has not been determined, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.5_0: If it has not been transferred, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.6_0: If they have not been given away, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.7_0: If they have not been lost, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.8_0: If they have not been destroyed, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.9_0: If it has not been burnt, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.10_0: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.11_0: If he uses robe-cloth that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.12_0: If it is less than ten days, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.13_0: If it is less than ten days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.14_0: If it is less than ten days and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.15.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.16_0: if within ten days it has been determined, transferred to another, given away, lost, destroyed, burnt, stolen, or taken on trust;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.18_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:5.1_0: At that time monks from the group six did not give back relinquished robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:5.3_0: “Monks, relinquished robe-cloth should be given back.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:5.4_0: If you don’t give it back, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:5.5_0: The first rule, the training rule on the robe-making season, is finished.
